title.narrative: FAMILY & COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES

description.narrative: Social welfare, education and health professionals have enhanced capacities for provision of inclusive family and community-based services for the most vulnerable children, including children affected by emergency situations., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Health, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Nutrition And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Government implements improved and equitable policy for prevention and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and exclusion of the most vulnerable children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social welfare, education and health professionals have enhanced capacities for provision of inclusive family and community-based services for the most vulnerable children, including children affected by emergency situations.

description.narrative: Significant improvements have been implemented during 2019 in cooperation with the Government and key partners in developing community- and family-based services for the most vulnerable children and families. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of trained foster parents (qualified pre-service training) / (RKLA 1 indicator)

baseline.value: 0 foster parents trained through the standardised initial training programme (and obtaining the licence during the year)

target.value: 2021:100 foster parents trained through the standardised initial training programme per year.

actual.value: 2020:134 foster parents participated in the test implementation of the new educational programme in 2019 and it was integrated into the regular practice of the social welfare professionals as from 2020. Additionally, there was 57 foster parents trained through the standardised initial training programme

title.narrative: Number of child care professionals with increased knowledge and skills for working with families at risks, gained through trainings and programmes supported by UNICEF within the CP 2017-2021

baseline.value: 0 social welfare professionals, 0 outreach workers (conducting 2 spec.individ. family interventions), 0 health, education, justice professionals

target.value: 2021:300 social welfare professionals, 300 outreach workers (conducting 2 specific individual family interventions), 400 health, education, justice professionals

actual.value: 2020:424 social welfare professionals, 287 outreach workers, 0 health, education, justice professionals.

title.narrative: Number of social service workers trained on specific knowledge and skills to deliver essential services during the COVID-19 pandemic with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID] i) total
Number of children without parental or family care provided with appropriate alternative care arrangements [COVIDSitRep]
Number of social service workers trained on specific knowledge and skills to deliver essential services during the COVID-19 pandemic with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID] ii) total female
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
Number of UNICEF personnel and partners that have completed training on GBV risk mitigation and referrals for survivors [COVIDSitRep]
Number of child professionals and frontline workers from organizations providing humanitarian assistance whose capacities are strengthened for emergency preparedness and response.

target.value: 2021:450, including at least 31 in current year

actual.value: 2020:401, from which 2 in current year. Additional activities are planned for the September-December 2020.

title.narrative: Status of alternative care policies and programmes adapted to respond to the COVID-19 Pandemic [COVID]

baseline.value: Alternative care policies and programmes are not adapted to the COVID.

target.value: 2020:Alternative care policies and programmes adapted to the COVID context and regularly updated and informed by most recent knowledge and evidence.

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF continuously supports responsible line ministry to timely adapt alternative care policies and programmes to the COVID context.

title.narrative: Availability of relevant, inclusive and community based services in child protection, health, and education to migrant children and children seeking international protection.

target.value: 2021:All relevant services meeting the needs of children are available.

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF ensured additional support (interpreters) to improve access to health services for 106 asylum seekers from which 26 children. CFS for 229 children was also supported.

title.narrative: Existence of updated emergency preparedness plans on COVID-19 outbreak and on refugee and migrant crisis

actual.value: 2020:Emergency preparedness plans on COVID-19 outbreak and on refugee and migrant crisis prepared and regularly updated.
